plugins.name: Blazy
plugins.description:
Blazy Figma plugin


Say goodbye to the challenges of motion design and embrace the power of Blazy, the ultimate Figma plugin that transforms your static designs into stunning animations with ease.


Leave behind the time-consuming struggle of manual animation editing. With Blazy, transform your designs into engaging animations instantly, eliminating the need for complex timelines.


Check out Blazy templates.


  • Advanced Mode: Tailored for users who demand intricate control and sophistication in their Figma animations.
  • Basic Mode: A user-friendly approach for straightforward animation additions.
  • Timeline and Keyframes: Create complex animations with multiple elements and control them using the timeline.
  • Dev Mode: Get CSS/React code for your animated elements.
  • Animation Presets: Access a library of 40+ animation presets for quick and easy animation creation.
  • Animation Timing: Fine-tune animation timing with easing controls and looping options.
  • Custom Properties: Add custom properties like opacity, scale, rotation, and more to your elements for unique animations.
  • Triggers: Assign triggers to keyframes to initiate animations on hover, click, drag, and more.
  • Saved Presets: Save your keyframe animations as presets for future use.
  • Text Animations: Create fully customizable text animations with Blazy's text splitting feature.


For more information and support, visit blazy.studio.

accepted.name: Orkhan Jafarov
accepted.description: Sr. Frontend Engineer @ Amazon

plugins.tagline: Ultimate Figma plugin to animate your prototype in one click

plugins.name: Spreadsheet Sync
plugins.description:
üß© Use dynamic data on your Figma from Google Spreadsheets.

üî• Fast data replace from Google Spreadsheet.

üòé Use Google Sheets as dynamic data on your design.

‚úÖ Works with Components, Frames, Layers... all (as long as the layer has sub-layers/children).


‚¨áÔ∏è ‚¨áÔ∏è ‚¨áÔ∏è CHECK THE STEPS BELOW ‚¨áÔ∏è ‚¨áÔ∏è ‚¨áÔ∏è


Not affiliated with Google ‚Ä¢ Created with ‚ù§Ô∏è by Andr√© Pinto


If you want to support the continued development of this plugin, why not buy me a coffee at:


ko-fi.com/apinix


SHARE THIS IF YOU LOVE IT! LETS MAKE THE BEST PLUGIN TO HELP THE COMMUNITY!


--------


STEP 1:

Your Google Spreadsheet has to be public

  1. Share > Get shareable link


STEP 2:

Use the correct naming on your Figma layers.

AUTO RENAMING... Rename manually or use the new renaming by clicking on the table (when on advanced mode).

MANUALLY RENAMING... add a # prefix followed by the name of the column you want to sync (ex: #Title).

You can nest multiple columns in one layer (Note: it is not case sensitive, and will ignore spaces).

Google Sheets column example names: (ex: Sheet / Figma)

  1. Text (Just text)
  2. Fill Color (/#E24A08)
  3. Stroke Width and Color (/2|#E24A08) or (/|#E24A08)
  4. Show (/Show)
  5. Hide (/Hide)
  6. Image (http://image-path...)
  7. Multiple (#Name#Color#Show)
  8. Multiple with Placeholders (layer name: #Value1#Value2 -> actual text: 'This is {#Value1} and is in the same sentence of {#Value 2}')


Google Sheets example:

| Title | Variant | Fill Color | Stroke | Hidden | Image |
| --------------- | ----------- | ---------- | ---------- | ------- | ----------------- |
| This is a title | Color=blue | /#ff0000 | /2|#ff0000 | /Show | http://image-path |
| This is a text | Color=green | /#0099ff | /|#0099ff | /Hide | http://image-path |


Figma layer naming example:

| ------------------------ |
| #Title | -> normal text replace
| ------------------------ |
| #Color.randsave | -> gets a random value from a random "saved" row (if you want to use the same random row on another layer)
| ------------------------ |
| #Hidden | -> hides or shows layer
| ------------------------ |
| #Image.rand | -> gets a random value
| ------------------------ |
| #Title.1#Color.randsave | -> text replacement and the same random saved color from before (if under the same selection))
| ------------------------ |



STEP 3:

Paste your Google Spreadsheet link (copy from browser address bar), select the amount of layers and click Sync.


EXTRA:

üî•üî•üî• Use the "Preview" button for an advanced usage (little blue button with eye icon next to the url input).

  1. You can rename layer(s) with just a click
  2. You can even multiple rename layers if you click SHIFT key


--------


EXAMPLES:

  1. Figma File
  2. Google Spreadsheet (example card)
  3. Google Spreadsheet (example table)

plugins.name: Chat Builder
plugins.description:
‚úèÔ∏è Please, drop your suggestions in the comments! It'll help make the plugin even better and more useful.


This plugin allows you to create chat frames with sender and receiver message bubbles, as well as date separators, for designing realistic messenger UIs in Figma.


You can customize the style and properties of the parent components to fit your design needs.



ü§ì How it works:


Set the frame size by specifying the width and height.

Use the "+ Sender", "+ Receiver", and "+ Date" buttons to add message bubbles and date separators.

Enter your text in the message bubbles or date separators.

Click "Create chat frame" to generate the chat UI frame with your specified messages and separators.

Customize the style of the parent components for message bubbles and date separators.



üìî How it works with customizable styles:


Adjust the style and properties of the parent components for sender, receiver, and date separator messages.

Style changes in the parent components will reflect across all instances within the frame.



‚úèÔ∏è Usage tips:


Use the "Remove" button next to each message bubble or date separator to delete it if needed.

Ensure the text content of messages and dates is appropriately entered before creating the frame.

This plugin simplifies the process of designing chat interfaces, saving you time and ensuring consistency in your UI designs. Start creating realistic chat frames in Figma today!


Made by Sergei Gotlsov
plugins.tagline: Create chat frames with message bubbles and date separators for designing messenger UI's in Figma.

plugins.name: Colormate
plugins.description:
About Colormate

Colormate is an AI powered color search engine that works in both your Figma and FigJam documents. Turn your ideas into colors, gradients, tones, shades, and more simply by asking.


Also included are Colormate's built-in color tools to find analogous, monochromatic, complementary, thematic, and similar colors.


Examples

Here are a few examples of what you can ask of Colormate:

"tones of the Empire State Building at sunset"

"a set of pastel colors based on the Canadian wilderness"

"flag of Sweden"

"I'm designing a website and need a color palette based on #C4D1C2, please include a text color, tint, shadow, and complementary colors"

"fried rice dish"

"colors for the characters of The Watchmen"


Features

‚Ä¢ Search for colors, palettes, themes and similar colors by asking.

‚Ä¢ Works with Figma and FigJam documents.

‚Ä¢ Automatic naming of color search results.

‚Ä¢ Lookup monochromatic colors.

‚Ä¢ Lookup analogous colors.

‚Ä¢ Lookup complementary colors.

‚Ä¢ Find similar and alternative colors.

‚Ä¢ Pull colors from image files dropped onto Colormate.

‚Ä¢ Keyboard navigation.

‚Ä¢ Copy colors by hex value.

‚Ä¢ Quick add color results to your document.

‚Ä¢ Search history per Colormate session.

‚Ä¢ Thoughtful keyboard navigation.

‚Ä¢ Dark mode support.


Tips & Shortcuts

Colormate is completely navigable from your keyboard. There are also a few handy shortcuts you can use as you get comfortable:


‚Ä¢ Hold option/alt key when clicking a color result to copy its hex value to the clipboard.

‚Ä¢ Press the up or down array keys to select different color results.

‚Ä¢ Press the back array key to go to the previous color results.

‚Ä¢ Hold option/alt when clicking the add button to add all of the color results to your Figma document.

‚Ä¢ Double-click a color result to ask Colormate to find more colors like it.

accepted.description: Cofound and led design at Path. Helped build Napster for macOS. Making Figma plugins that I find useful in my own work and hope you do too. üòä

plugins.name: Offgrid
plugins.description:
This plugin helps you create grids where every other row or column needs to be offset e.g. hexagonal grids or brick patterns.


How to Use

1. Select a node (works best with a component)

2. Run the plugin

3. Adjust values for rows, columns, spacing and offset

4. Click Create


Open Source: https://github.com/forsartis/figma-offgrid

plugins.name: Find Variables
plugins.description:
Find Variables helps you find what variables are being used in your file and easily select the layers using them.


Features:

  • Displays all the variables being used in a given page.
  • Shows all the layer types using a variable (frame, text, etc.)
  • Select all layers by type or all the layers using a given variable.


Not sure what frames are using a new corner radius? Can't find a specific string variable somewhere in your prototype? This plugin makes it easy to find, and select, any layers using a variable.


Not supported yet:

  • I only display one mode currently for simplicity
  • Send any bugs my way or leave a comment!


This plugin is free, available on Github as an open source resource, and doesn't use any network calls so its safe for enterprise usage.

Creator of a few figma plugins, musician,  and most importantly a dad.

plugins.name: central icon system
plugins.description:
The plugin for central.


Streamline your design workflow with our plugin, making the central icon system a breeze to use.


Some of the features of the central plugin:


  • Super-Fast Search: Our icons are named both semantically and symbolically, making it incredibly easy to find exactly what you need.


  • Multiple Export Options: Due to popular demand, we now support exporting icons as SVG, React, React Native, and Solid.js.


  • No Lengthy Imports: Instead of importing over 30,000 icons, access our icon system through a simple and effective UI.


  • Easy Discovery: Quickly find what you're looking for by selecting from logical categories.


  • Customizable Appearance: Adjust Solid or Lined, Stroke Width, and Corner Style easily through a simple options panel.


We're offering the chance to test the plugin and import/export up to 20 icons to see just how much it can enhance your workflow.




The central icon system.


‚ú¶ What?

A collection of icons that will make your product design easier and faster. With over 1000 symbols in 30 variations each, you have more than 30,000 icons at your disposal.


‚ú¶ Why?

Our icons are simple and versatile. You can adjust them to fit your brand and style: stroke width, border radius, line or filled version. All variations can be accessed directly through our plugin. Whatever you choose, our icons will look crisp and clean on any device and screen size.


‚ú¶ How?

Each icon variation is hand crafted in Figma for Figma to make sure every change of a property corresponds to the icon system. This ensures consistency and quality across the entire set. Our icons are designed on a 24x24 px grid and is based on an enhanced grid system to make sure every icon is consistent to the core.


The central icon system is not just another icon set. It‚Äôs a tool that will help you create better products faster.



Made by iconists


www.iconists.co

plugins.name: Free Breakpoints
plugins.description:
Preview responsive layout inside a Figma frame.


‚úÖ Works even without the opened plugin window and anyone in your team can resize frame without the installed plugin.


‚õîÔ∏è There are a couple of restrictions:

  1. Layouts must have a filled background without transparency
  2. Hug contents value for breakpoint frame is not supported

‚ÑπÔ∏è This is because all the breakpoint layers are in one frame, one on top of the other. And this is the only way to get such an effect in Figma.


How to use?

step1: Create more than one frames of different breakpoints with their max width.

step2: Select all the above frames.

step3: Run the plugin. It creates a component with name Responsive frame. Just create instance of this component and resize width to see responsive layout.


License:

free without any restrictions.
plugins.tagline: Responsive layout inside figma frame.

plugins.name: HCL Easy | Color Palette | Accessibility
plugins.description:
Creat advanced palettes for all themes of your design system, taking into account color blindness and contrast.


https://hcleasy.com


Color Matrix and Automation

All colors are presented in the form of a matrix. This allows you to create many harmonious palettes for your light and dark themes. You can automatically build Hue, Chroma, and Lightness using Bezier Curves


Color Blindness and Contrast

Using the "Accessibility" function, you can check the entire color matrix for contrast with one form or another of color blindness


Adapted Color Space for Humans

We use the CIELab color space, it allows you to linearly align colors relative to the color perception of a person and the mathematical values ‚Äã‚Äãof the Hue, Chroma, Lightness axes.


The best start with the bests

We suggest you start creating your own palette based on existing ones, from the most popular design systems of the world
plugins.tagline: Palette generator, editor, and manager. Create accessible-first palettes and for your design system.

plugins.name: Diagram Connector
plugins.description:
Simple tool made for quickly creating diagrams.


How to use it:


  1. Select two objects.

  3. Experiment with parameters.

Have fun! Hope it helps.

plugins.name: Radial Cloner
plugins.description:
Radial Cloner is a figma plugin that can create clones of a selected object around a circle. The number of copies and circle width along with alignment of the objects can be specified in the plugin.


How to use


Select an object and run the plugin. The clone count option lets you change the number of copies to be created. The circle width lets you choose the width of the circle onto which the objects will be cloned.


NOTE: The objects will be cloned with their center on the circle. The circle width value does not equate to the width and height of the final cloned output.


The alignment option lets you either align the clones tangentially to the circle or maintain the initial orientation for all clones. Click on the create clones to create a new radial group.

accepted.name: Abhishek Shankar
accepted.description: Product Designer & Tinkerer

plugins.tagline: Create copies of your selections around a circle to make circular patterns

plugins.name: GradientGaze
plugins.description:
Using GradientGaze is a breeze. Here's how it works:


  1. Open GradientGaze in Figma: Start by selecting the GradientGaze plugin within your Figma workspace.
  2. Explore the Gradient Options: You'll find a collection of pre-set, iridescent and holographic gradients, each represented by a round button.
  3. Apply with a Click: Simply click on one of these round buttons to see the gradient come to life on your design element.
  4. Customize as Needed: Adjust the intensity, angle, or blend of the gradient directly in Figma.


With GradientGaze, adding a touch of holographic is just a button-click away. It's designed for ease and creative exploration, making your design process both fun and efficient.
plugins.tagline: Shades in holographic ways. Designs get a shimmering, iridescent blaze.

plugins.name: Remix Icon Set by Iconduck
plugins.description:
The 2,271 open source icons from Remix are available under the Apache 2.0 license. They're ideal for mobile, desktop or web design, since there's thousands of icons to cover almost all possible user interface needs.


Popular icons:

  • Arrows
  • Social media brands
  • Security / lock icons
  • Design icons
  • Photography and camera icons
  • User profile icons


However, since there are literally thousands of them, you'll find almost everything you need in this icon library.


Plugin features:

  • Drag and drop any icons
  • Search through them instantly
  • Click any icon to add it your design


Coming soon:

  • Save your favorite Remix icons
  • View your search history
  • View your embed history

plugins.name: Airtable to Figma
plugins.description:
Warning: this plugin is not actively maintained.

2022 update: This plugin was broken between Nov 8 and Dec 16 due to a change by Airtable.


Airtable & Figma, kinda sounds like an unusual marriage, right? Sure, until you need to design an entire data table, or a dozen different cards of the same variety, at which point you‚Äôll be wishing for an easier way to go about it. Luckily, now there is! This plugin allows you to effortlessly pull text and images from an Airtable database and inject them straight into your Figma components. Using the plugin is child‚Äôs play. First, you build your component in Figma, business as usual. Then, you load up the Airtable 2 Figma plugin, and map the Airtable data fields to the right layers in Figma. Finally, choose the layout you want your component to be laid out as and voil√†, you just saved yourself a couple hundred clicks! You now have a nice set of data directly inserted into your designs.


This plugin is not under active maintenance or support, but you can discuss things at https://github.com/thgh/Airtable-to-Figma


Take a gander at the data types we can import directly from Airtable into Figma:


1. Single line text

2. Long text

3. Phone number

4. Email

5. Numeric

6. Image


Here‚Äôs a sample database (about cats) for you to experiment with: https://airtable.com/shr0hyEnBae0AKKfQ


Next, follow these steps:


1. Go to https://airtable.com and build or select your own table

2. In your Airtable of choice, click ‚ÄòShare‚Äô

3. Scroll down and click ‚ÄòCreate a shared view‚Äô

4. Click ‚ÄòShare the current view‚Äô

5. Next, click ‚ÄòCreate a shareable grid view‚Äô.

6. Then, copy the link and paste it in the plugin window.

7. Assign Airtable columns to text nodes or images.

8. Select the view you want to use and configure the rest

9. Done! For every row in your table, an instance will be created.


Sounds pretty cool, right?


Missing a particular feature? Hit us up at https://github.com/thgh/Airtable-to-Figma/issues
plugins.tagline: Load your actual data in your designs!

plugins.name: Hidden Kittens
plugins.description:
The Hidden Kittens plugin will help give an emotional touch to your work. These Kittens are skilled at design and they will tell you what they think about your design decisions. You can replace the art-director in your team with these Kittens.

How to use:
1. Choose the frames you want to add cats to.
2. Launch the Hidden Kittens plugin.
3. Voila! Kittens will appear in a random place of every selected frame.

New Kittens are constantly added and will bring more emotions to your work, stay tuned!

Not for commercial use.

plugins.name: Dynamic Data
plugins.description:
Dynamic Data is a simple plug-in that gives you the option of saving time through automation. This plug-in can save you hours of tedious work, enhancing organisation, and thus, productivity. 


Built with the ability to create multiple variations of your artwork, it can integrate a single data source file, such as a CSV or XLSX file with a Figma document. If you are looking for a source that can assist you in saving time and avoiding data entry errors, Dynamic Data is the solution.


Examples of tasks it can assist with include the output of business cards and issuing numerous amounts of certificates for hundreds of individuals. Any job that is repetitive or monotonous can be time-consuming, but with Dynamic Data these endless hours spent on manually entering text data from a spreadsheet can be re-used using the same design.



How to Use Dynamic Data


  1. Select a frame layer
  2. Ensure to rename the dynamic text layers (variable1 ... variable9)
  3. Tick the "Variable frame name" checkbox if you want to rename the new cloned frames (the first column in the spreadsheet will be used)
  4. Select the spreadsheet with the data
  5. Select the export format
  6. Click on Fetch and the new cloned frames will be ready to be exported once finished
  7. Click on Export and all the files will be exported at once in the format you selected



Please note the following:

  • Naming the variables is not case sensitive.
  • The plug-in skips empty columns in the data source file. So, if the first column is empty, the second column will be used for Variable1.

plugins.name: figrid
plugins.description:
Figrid helps you to create patterns by placing elements on grid in a way you chose. Thanks to this plugin you won't waste your time on copying and manually placig elements to make pattern, figrid will do it instead.


Step by step:

* Select element you want to create pattern from. (optional)

* Open figrid and select fitting options

* Below all options you will see preview of your pattern.

* If everything looks as it should, simply click create.


Figrid is open-source project, so you can check it's code here: https://github.com/KUB4W16/figrid.

What is Frontify?

Frontify delivers a centralized place to manage, create, and share digital assets, guidelines, templates, and increase your visual collaboration ‚Äì helping you build stronger brand experiences across the board.


Why Connecting Figma with Frontify?

With our new Figma integration, you‚Äôre able to access complete libraries of your digital assets living in Frontify, directly from within Figma. Those assets ‚Äì images, logos, icons (and a lot more) ‚Äì are managed and stored in Frontify.


Get started

1) Signup for Frontify

2) Create asset libraries and guidelines within Frontify (https://help.frontify.com/en/)

plugins.name: Generator
plugins.description:
The first node-based plugin with the power to create generative art right in Figma, no code required.


Generator is a multiplier for your imagination, whether you are making randomized abstract backgrounds or detailed intricate patterns, visualizing JSON data or generating a complete color system from a single seed color.



What users are saying


  1. ‚ÄúGenerator became integral to my visual design workflow in less than a week. The most important thing is that it allows me to view art not as impulsively splashing colors into a canvas, but as building blocks and fitting modules. Generator truly is a way for art to transmit logic into emotion.‚Äù ‚Äî @hunktwink123


  1. ‚ÄúThank you for teaching the class on Generator for our generative design course! My students used Generator to make a lot of awesome stuff and loved it!‚Äú ‚Äî @i_dianov


  1. ‚ÄúVisual programming methods open up the possibilities of generative design for specialists who are far from writing code. Generator‚Äôs user-friendly interface and integration into Figma are a strong argument for both professionals and students to start learning this tool.‚Äù ‚Äî @novichkovnet


  1. ‚ÄúDesigners looking to systemize their brand work will want to learn this tool. I use Generator for brand work that requires precise and procedural designs. It's the ultimate way to codify graphics. And because you are in control it's easy to develop unique illustration systems using your own parameters.‚Äù ‚Äî @grazsebastian



How Generator improves your work


  1. Nodes automate working with shapes, colors, numbers and text. You can have precise control over all aspects of your designs.


  1. Generated results are regular editable Figma objects which you can instantly use in your existing Figma workflow.


  1. Fearlessly experiment with infinite variations by automating just a few parameters.


  1. Everything can be randomized ‚Äî this is your secret weapon. When creativity struggles, use randomness to get inspired by unexpected and delightful results.


  1. Real data can be used to drive your designs. Fetch JSON from the web and visualize it in any way that you need.


  1. Connect Generator values to Figma variables. This gives you an unprecedented level of automation and control for your design and color systems.



Generator on Youtube | X | Discord | Telegram
plugins.tagline: Geometry nodes for Figma

plugins.name: Arranger
plugins.description:
What it does

Arrange any number of objects in 10 different layout types, like radial (full circle or arc), along a custom vector path, pack an area with objects, and much more.


This plugin helps you to build radial menus, watch faces, HUD display graphics, some (basic) particle effects, backgrounds, and interesting patterns.


With additional random options for size, rotation, opacity, you can create stunning layouts in seconds.

Arranger is also available for FigJam.


Layout types

  • Radial
  • Along Vector Path
  • Hex
  • Grid
  • Wave
  • Triangle
  • Spiral
  • Packing
  • Confetti
  • Explosion



How it works

Choose a layout type and then select objects that you want to be arranged.


There are two ways:


  • Option A: Select multiple objects and Arranger will just use them. This is great when every object is unique (e.g. icons or menu items).
  • Option B: Select a single object and create clones of it. Arranger will use the clones. Use this when your objects are all the same, say for a background pattern or ticks on a watch face.



Get more information

www.omata.io/arranger



Updates, feedback, and support

E-Mail: support@omata.io

X (Twitter):

  • OMATA (the brand): https://twitter.com/omata_design
  • Me (the creator): https://twitter.com/plugisto


What else?

Arranger is also available for Adobe Illustrator, InDesign and Photoshop.





You are still here?

Well, please share your creations and use cases with me. I am super excited about what you will do with Arranger.

accepted.name: Plugisto
accepted.description: Developing tools for designers. Creator of Adobe plugins Omata (@omata_design), Arranger, Xray and Delaunoi.

plugins.tagline: Quick and creative arrangement of objects and frames

40640.name: Figma Section
40640.description:
Use sections in Figma to easily organize your designs!


Official website


Feature:

  • Drag sections to move and resize them.
  • Sections can be infinitely nested.
  • Nested section titles are always visible
  • Section titles are perfectly visible under all zoom levels
  • Copy Section with its contents.
  • Collaborators without the plugin can also copy and edit sections
  • Sections will automatically envelop overlapping objects
  • Quickly switch between 6 ready made themes
  • Plugin works in two modes: Native mode and Simulation Mode
  • Sections created in simulation mode will display nested frame titles, but will require the plugin to be running to adjust and duplicate.
  • Sections created with Native mode do not require the plugin to modify and duplicate, but won‚Äôt display nested frame titles, only nested Section titles are displayed

plugins.name: LoremGenie
plugins.description:
We are committed to replacing traditional Lorem Ipsum with rich and meaningful content, ensuring that the filler content closely relates to the design drafts and avoiding a reduction in overall design quality due to inconsistent image styles.


Features


‚ö° Easily fill layers with content in just a few steps

Simply select a layer and click on the content you want to fill, and the data will be filled into the layer.

Additionally, you can drag content or click on it without selecting a layer, easily creating new layers with data.


üåü Diverse content covering 22 main categories

  • Users: Avatar, name, username, email, phone number, job, introduction, etc.
  • Articles: Cover, title, summary, full text, creation time, views, etc.
  • Products: Cover, name, description, price, quantity, etc.
  • Comments: Content, author, creation time, etc.
  • Movies: Cover, name, description, category, director, duration, etc.
  • Addresses: State, city, street, detailed address, etc.
  • Countries: Flag, name, abbreviation, main languages, etc.
  • Social Media Company Info: Icon, name, website, etc.
  • And more categories for you to explore...


‚úçÔ∏è Custom Content

If our provided content does not meet your needs, you can create custom content within the plugin.


ü§ñ AI Generate Data

In the plugin, you can use ChatGPT to quickly generate data that meets your project requirements.

For example, tell ChatGPT: "Please provide a list of the most popular movies of 2021, including movie names, descriptions, directors, main actors, and duration."


üì• Import Custom Content

You can easily import content from Notion into the plugin, and we plan to support other formats like JSON, CSV in the future.


‚öôÔ∏è Custom Content Formatting

Supports converting dates, numbers, names, emails, etc., into specific formats.


üé® Multiple Avatar Styles Available

We offer four different styles of avatars to meet diverse design needs, including solid-color backgrounds, object-backgrounds, Emoji style, and text avatars.


üåÑ Uniform style and content-related images

The content we provide includes images related to it, with a consistent style across all major categories.


üë§ Quick Filling of Personal Information

During the design process, it often requires filling in personal information such as name, email, avatar, etc. into design drafts.

Using our plugin, you can quickly fill in these details, reducing repetitive work.


üåê Supports Multiple Languages

The content we provide supports multiple languages, including English and Chinese(ÁÆÄ‰Ωì‰∏≠Êñá).



To learn more, please visit our website: https://loremgenie.com.


You can also watch this video https://youtu.be/zlhi4YxLiu0 for a better understanding of how to use the plugin.


Our documentation: https://loremgenie.com/en/docs/getting-started will help you use the plugin more effectively.


If you encounter any problems or have valuable suggestions during use, please contact us through guojiangnian@outlook.com.
plugins.tagline: Replace traditional Lorem Ipsum with rich and meaningful content.

plugins.name: fromCSS
plugins.description:
Write, paste, and apply CSS

Select node/nodes to apply .fromCSS styles. After plugin relaunch .fromCSS block will be blank.

Write your notes below .fromCSS block. Notes will be saved in the same place after plugin, project or even Figma relaunch.


Use cases

  1. Apply CSS from different generators like: https://neumorphism.io/, https://brumm.af/shadows, https://www.cssmatic.com/box-shadow
  2. Get rid of manual adding effects from CSS.
  3. Save CSS notes to reuse in the project.
  4. Edit node properties fast


How it works

  1. You can select a node or nodes before or after the plugin is launched. When you change the selection styles from the block .fromCSS will be applied immediately.
  2. Block .fromCSS must be the first. The name can be changed.
  3. When applying styles for effects and backgrounds, the plugin looks for conflicts and removes only effects and fills with the same type as you have in CSS, while all the others remain unchanged. Conflicts are searched individually for each selected node.
  4. If you add something inside the plugin, you will see changes, and if you decide to delete something via plugin nothing will happen, this is due to the specifics of the plugin: quickly add with removing conflicts, but do not replace the functionality of standard controls in Figma.


What is supported (the rest is ignored by the plugin)

  1. width
  2. height
  3. opacity
  4. mix-blend-mode
  5. border-radius
  6. background
  7. background-color
  8. background-blend-mode
  9. box-shadow
  10. backdrop-filter: blur()
  11. transform: rotate()
  12. filter: blur()
  13. color
  14. font-size: px, rem, em, %
  15. line-height: px, rem, em, %, and unitless shorthand
  16. text-align
  17. text-decoration: except overline
  18. text-transform
  19. text-shadow


Future releases

Borders, Background images: images, gradients(I'm in search of a good parser for the last one).


Demonstration

https://youtu.be/zVazGBugYpA


Support

https://jamillazarev.gumroad.com/l/fromCSS


Contributors

Jamil Lazarev üá¶üáø: Plugin creator and maintainer

Twitter | Github

Tait Brown üá¶üá∫: Added font support

Twitter | Github

plugins.name: Figma Color Variables Import / Export
plugins.description:
Register the Color Token created with Token Studio etc. in Figma's Variables.


Usage

‚óèImport from JSON to Variables

1. Export Color Token to JSON by Token Studio or other tools

2. Import Color Token to JSON by this plugin


‚óèExport Variables to JSON

Click „ÄåExport With Alias„Äç or„ÄåExport With RawValue„Äç

(This JSON file can be read by Token Studio)


Function

  • ‚úÖ Solid (Fill 100%)
  • ‚úÖ Solid (Fill not 100%)
  • üôÖ Gradient
  • üôÖ String
  • üôÖ Number



Sample Token

{
  "color": { // immediate object key to Collection name
    "primitive": {
      "white": {
        "value": "#FFFFFF",
        "type": "color"
      }
    },
    "semantic": {
      "background": {
        "light": {
          "value": "{color.primitive.white}",
          "description": "light background",
          "type": "color"
        }
      }
    }
  }
}
plugins.tagline: A minimal plugin to transfer JSON to Figma variables.

  • And copy your colors

That's all!

plugins.name: Remove Objects ‚Äî by ‚Äπdiv‚Ä∫RIOTS
plugins.description:
Remove objects from any image, right in Figma.

Paint over any object or person in an image to remove it completely. A fast and accurate way to make undesired elements disappear!


How to remove objects from images in Figma:

  1. Select the image you want to edit and run the remove.objects plugin.
  2. Choose your brush size and paint over the object you want to remove. For best results, paint outside the object‚Äôs edges.
  3. Click ‚ÄúRemove Objects‚Äù.
  4. You‚Äôll get the same image with the undesired object(s) gone!

plugins.name: eezin
plugins.description:
Preview, compare, use and learn about standard easing functions for your custom prototype easings.


How to use

  1. Open eezin.
  2. Explore a list of standard easing functions for Ease In, Ease Out and Ease In & Out.
  3. Preview any function by clicking on the Preview column for each of the functions.
  4. Add another function to compare if you're having doubts.
  5. Click the function name to copy de cubic bezier value.
  6. Paste into your custom easing in the Interaction Details of your prototype interaction.
  7. Create smooth, beautiful prototypes.

plugins.name: Figma to Code
plugins.description: Select an element in Figma and click on the plugin to run it. Click on the "Generate Code" button, it will generate the react code for the selected element. You can use the "Copy to clipboard" button to copy the generated code.
plugins.tagline: The plugin generates React code for the selected Figma element.
